Unit Plans

Comprehensive, culturally-integrated learning units designed for Aotearoa New Zealand classrooms

ğŸ”¥ Featured

Design Your Society

Guided Inquiry Unit | Year 8

Students design their ideal society through guided inquiry, incorporating MÄori governance principles, systems thinking, and collaborative decision-making processes.

5 Weeks Social Studies Interactive
  • Complete lesson plans with cultural integration
  • Interactive society design tool
  • Assessment rubrics and templates
  • Student materials and handouts
Explore Unit

Y7 Mathematics: Algebra

Mathematics | Year 7

Introduction to algebraic thinking through cultural contexts, patterns, and real-world applications that connect to Te Ao MÄori mathematical concepts.

8 Weeks Mathematics Cultural
  • Pattern recognition and sequences
  • Variables and expressions
  • Cultural mathematical concepts
  • Interactive digital tools
Explore Unit

Y8 Critical Thinking

English | Year 8

Develop critical thinking skills through analysis of texts, media, and cultural perspectives, building students' ability to question, evaluate, and form reasoned opinions.

6 Weeks English Analysis
  • Bias detection and analysis
  • Source evaluation techniques
  • Argument construction
  • Media literacy skills
Explore Unit

Y9 Science: Ecology

Science | Year 9

Explore ecological systems through both Western scientific methods and traditional MÄori knowledge of environmental relationships and sustainability.

7 Weeks Science Environmental
  • Ecosystem interactions
  • Traditional ecological knowledge
  • Field study opportunities
  • Sustainability practices
Explore Unit

Writers Toolkit

English | Year 8

Comprehensive writing skills development using the Y8 Systems gold standard methodology, integrating cultural perspectives and modern writing techniques.

10 Lessons English Writing
  • PEEL paragraph structure
  • Argumentative writing
  • Cultural storytelling
  • Digital writing tools
Explore Unit

Y9 Mathematics: Geometry

Mathematics | Year 9

Discover geometric concepts through traditional MÄori patterns, tukutuku designs, and architectural principles that demonstrate sophisticated mathematical understanding.

8 Weeks Mathematics Cultural
  • Geometric transformations
  • Tukutuku pattern analysis
  • Traditional architecture
  • Mathematical art creation
Explore Unit
